table.name: uom
table.description: This table stores the various Unit Of Measures that can be used in the calculations in GC3. Some examples of UOM are: Speed - Mile Per Hour, Kilometer Per Hour etc, Duration - Days, Minutes, Hour etc.

columns.name: TYPE
columns.description: TYPE contains the type for the unit of measure. Examples include: DISTANCE DURATION LENGTH SPEED TEMPERATURE VOLUME WEIGHT

columns.name: UOM_CODE
columns.description: UOM_CODE contains an abbreviation for the unit of measure. Examples include CUFT, LB and YD.

columns.name: UOM_SHORT_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: UOM_SHORT_DESCRIPTION contains an abbreviated name for the unit of measure. Examples include CAN GAL, KPH and NAUT MI.

columns.name: UOM_LONG_DESCRIPTION
columns.description: UOM_LONG_DESCRIPTION contains the full name for the unit of measure. Examples include METRIC TONS, POUNDS and YARDS.

columns.name: IS_STORAGE_DEFAULT
columns.description: The IS_STORAGE_DEFAULT column, when set to Y, indicates that the given uom_code is the storage default for all database columns of the given type.  For example, LB is the default code for all WEIGHT related columns.

columns.name: IS_DISPLAY_DEFAULT
columns.description: The IS_DISPLAY_DEFAULT column, when set to Y, indicates that the given uom_code is the display default for all display fields of the given type.
